DOC.HEADLINE: WORLD IN BRIEF ; EGYPT ; PROGRESS_REPORTED IN ISRAEL-PLO TALKS
DOC.TEXT: Israeli and Palestine Liberation Organization negotiators meeting in Cairo reported progress toward implementing their accord on limited Palestinian self-rule in the occupied territories . In a joint statement issued at the end of three days of talks , negotiators said they still need more time to resolve security and administrative issues and hope for further progress when talks resume next week.The latest round of talks focused_on security arrangements for the Gaza Strip and the West_Bank town of Jericho , the size of the Palestinian police_force and where Palestinian police will be deployed . In Jerusalem , Israeli Foreign Minister Shimon Peres said Israeli troops can withdraw from the Gaza Strip and the West_Bank region of Jericho four weeks after Israel and the PLO resolve disputes holding_up an autonomy agreement .
